MS MCQs

    Authenticate apps to Azure services by using service principals and managed identities for Azure resources - Authentication with managed identities

    »

    1. What is the Azure Instance Metadata Service?

      The framework that’s used to authenticate to an IaaS (infrastructure as a service) VM

      A REST API endpoint that’s accessible from an IaaS VM

      A service that contains detailed data for provisioned Azure resources

      The service used for service principal objects


    2. Why can’t a custom application that’s hosted on-premises use managed identities?

      Custom applications don’t support managed identities.

      Managed identities are supported only in Azure AD.

      Managed identities can be used only with Azure resources.

      Managed identity is a feature of Azure virtual machines.
